com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface sendOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface sendOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document sendOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The sendOrder API can be used to raise an event when all of the order lines of an existing order reach a given status.

    • Method Detail

      • sendOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document sendOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                               org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                               java.rmi.RemoteException

        The sendOrder API can be used to raise an event when all of the order lines of an existing order reach a given status. For this API to be used, the entire ORDERED_QTY of each order line must be in the given status.

        The SendOrder transaction should have the pickup and drop statuses along with the event to be raised configured. The sendOrder API changes the current order line status to the required drop status corresponding to the pickup status configured on the SendOrder transaction. This transaction should be derived from the SEND_ORDER base transaction.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None.

        Events Raised:

        Raised under the transaction passed by the user.

          ON_SUCCESS
          This event is raised if the order can be sent.

            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Data published - YFS_SEND_ORDER_CREATE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Template Support - Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven.
            Configuration Required for Backward Compatability - No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions:
        The order must exist in the system.
        The entire order must be in pickable status.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven.

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all nodes except the Reference node.

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:
        If any status record with non-zero status quantity is not in a pickable status, a "YFS10457 - All status records of the Order cannot be picked for processing the transaction." error is raised.
        If the sendOrder API is to be executed for a completely cancelled order, it must be specifically configured to pickup Cancelled status.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the sent order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Order
        Key Attributes:

          EnterpriseCode
          Conditional. Either EnterpriseCode and OrderNo or OrderHeaderKey of the order to be sent must be passed.

          OrderNo
          Conditional. Either EnterpriseCode and OrderNo or OrderHeaderKey of the order to be sent must be passed.

          OrderHeaderKey
          Conditional. Either EnterpriseCode and OrderNo or OrderHeaderKey of the order to be sent must be passed.

          TransactionId
          Mandatory. This transaction should be derived from the base transaction SEND_ORDER. If the TransactionId is missing, following is the error message : YFS10171 - YFS: Blank Transaction ID.

        If the order, to be sent, does not exist in the database, following is the error message : YFS10242 - YFS:No Order is found for Processing
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
